intro: Chanekia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican heath, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It typically blooms in spring and produces small, dark berries that are edible for some bird species. Chanekia mexicana thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
